chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Somchai Chang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/school.

Assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. 
DNA sample.
Jail credit applies if revoked. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED jail with Huber for rule violations.

Case Called: 8:35
Includes: 14CF246 and 14CM534
State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard.  Defendant does not appear. Atty Lou Ann Bohn appears.

BWA: $1500
BFH: 9-30-14 @ 8:30
Adj: 8:37
BOTR: 8:38
Defendant now appears, State appears by Lance Leonhard, Atty Lou Ann Bohn appears.
BW quashed, BFH may be taken off the calendar.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
State moves to: 14CF246>>Count 2, Count 3, Count 4 and Count 5>>DRI
14CM534>>Count 2>>DRI
Court grants.
PLEA: 14CF246>>Count 1>>Possess w/Intent/Second & Subsequent>>No Contest
14CM534>>Count 1>>OWI 2nd/Repeater>>No Contest
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF246>>WS; Probation for 6 years with Conditions of: Impose and Stay 1 year MCJ w/Huber for rule violations, assessment/counseling/treatment including AODA deemed appropriate by agent, absolute sobriety, good faith effort to maintain FTE/School, CC, Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Has 46 days credit if revoked.
14CM534>>5 days MCJ w/Huber with credit for 5 days for time served. Fine of $1379 inclusive, 12 mos DLR and 12 mos IID-qualifies for 1/2 price, 6 pts. Court signs 1/2 price Order.

INCLUDES 14CM534, 14CF246.    Shall not consume alcohol.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - DAY REPORT for drug and alcohol - within 5 business days - SSTOP Program.   No contact with co-defendant(s): G.Q. Defendant to reside with the family at 3106 Falcon Way, Wausau Wisconsin.  Curfew of 10:00 pm to 6:00 am unless he's employed and the job interferes with the curfew.
